dataset_name.description: Name of the final table (should include only letters, numbers, dash and underscores. Note that this may be altered according to destination.)

provider.description: Storage Provider or Location of the file(s) to be replicated.

bucket.description: Name of the S3 bucket where the file(s) exist.

aws_access_key_id.description: In order to access private Buckets stored on AWS S3, this connector would need credentials with the proper permissions. If accessing publicly available data, this field is not necessary.

aws_secret_access_key.description: In order to access private Buckets stored on AWS S3, this connector would need credentials with the proper permissions. If accessing publicly available data, this field is not necessary.

path_prefix.description: By providing a path-like prefix (e.g. "myFolder/thisTable/") to the desired blobs, we can optimise finding these in S3. This is recommended if your bucket contains many folders/files.

format.description: File Format of the file to be replicated (Warning: some format may be experimental, please refer to docs).

quotechar.description: leave blank to default to " (double quote)

encoding.description: leave blank to default to UTF-8 (see list of python encodings).

additional_reader_options.description: Add a valid JSON string here to provide additional options to the csv reader (see details here)
